Description: Body sherd of East Greek (Milesian?) pottery cup; interior: black with band of white-red-white stripes; exterior: reserved; inscription incised on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Edgar incorrectly identifies the sherd as Chian.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 696, no. 533)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.841)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
